text: King’s College criteria for liver transplantation in acute liver failure® Paracetamol-related ALF: Either * Arterial pH <7.3 or [H*] >50 following resuscitation Or all of the following within 24 hours * Manchester PT >100 seconds * (Creatinine > 300 pmol/litre * Grade 3 or 4 encephalopathy Non-paracetamol related ALF: Either * Manchester PT>100 seconds (irrespective of encephalopathy grade) Or three or more of the following variables: * Age <10 or >40 years * Unfavourable cause: non-A—E hepatitis, halothane hepatitis, drug reaction * Duration of jaundice before encephalopathy >7 days * PT >50 seconds * Bilirubin >300 pmol/litre ALF, acute liver failure; PT, prothrombin time.
